data.chText: （不用茶碟的有柄的）大杯，缸子， 马克杯
data.enText: a tall cup for drinking from, usually with straight sides and a handle, used without a saucer
a coffee mug
a beer mug (= a large glass with a handle)
a mug and what it contains
a mug of coffee
a person's face

data.chText: 我再也不想看到他那张丑恶的面孔。
data.enText: I never want to see his ugly mug again.
a person who is stupid and easy to trick

data.chText: 他们弄得我像个十足的傻瓜。
data.enText: They made me look a complete mug.
He's no mug.
a mug's game

data.chText: 徒劳无功的事；不易成功的事；不易获利的事
data.enText: an activity that is unlikely to be successful or make a profit
to attack sb violently in order to steal their money, especially in a public place

data.chText: 光天化日之下，她在街上遭到抢劫。
data.enText: She had been mugged in the street in broad daylight.

data.chText: （尤指在舞台上或摄影机前）扮鬼脸，扮怪相
data.enText: to make silly expressions with your face or behave in a silly, exaggerated way, especially on the stage or before a camera
to mug for the cameras
mug sth↔up
mug up on sth
to learn sth, especially in a short time for a particular purpose, for example an exam

means: (不用茶碟的有柄的)大杯，缸子， 马克杯
(尤指在舞台上或摄影机前)扮鬼脸，扮怪相

ex.enText: She punched him in the face.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指头部的正面。

ex.chText: 这份礼物让她面露喜色。
ex.enText: The present left her with a pleasant countenance.

ex.chText: 他听到这个消息后脸色变了。
ex.enText: His countenance changed when he heard the news.

ex.chText: 看看你这张丑八怪的脸！用化妆品都没用！
ex.enText: Look at your ugly mug! Even makeup won't work!

ex.chText: 他扮了个不礼貌的鬼脸。

synonyms.bx: 指人的脸，也可指开玩笑或恶作剧时扮的怪相。

ex.chText: 作家将其小说中的主角描写为“那张孔武黝黑的英俊面孔显得瘦削而憔悴”。
ex.enText: The writer described the protagonist in his novel with 'the strong and darkly handsome visage was gaunt and haggard'.

synonyms.bx: 主要用于文学作品中，不用于日常会话和一般写作中。

data.enText: a mug's game

data.chText: 徒劳无功的事；不易成功的事；不易获利的事
data.enText: an activity that is unlikely to be successful or make a profit
mug sth↔up
mug up on sth
to learn sth, especially in a short time for a particular purpose, for example an exam

tr: the human face (`kisser' and `smiler' and `mug' are informal terms for `face' and `phiz' is British)
a person who is gullible and easy to take advantage of
the quantity that can be held in a mug
rob at gunpoint or with the threat of violence
example: I was mugged in the streets of New York last night

value.def: A mug is a large deep cup with straight sides and a handle, used for hot drinks.

example.ex: He spooned instant coffee into two of the mugs.
example.tran: 他用勺子把速溶咖啡舀入两个杯子中。

posc.def: A mug of something is the amount of it contained in a mug.

example.ex: He had been drinking mugs of coffee to keep himself awake.
example.tran: 为让自己保持清醒，他一杯接一杯地喝咖啡。

value.tran: 马克杯(用来喝热饮的有柄大杯子）

value.def: If someone mugs you, they attack you in order to steal your money.

example.ex: I was walking out to my car when this guy tried to mug me...
example.tran: 我正出门朝我的车走去，就在这时这家伙企图对我进行抢劫。

example.ex: He has been mugged more than once.
example.tran: 他已是不止一次被抢劫了。

example.ex: Bank robberies, burglaries and muggings are reported almost daily in the press...
example.tran: 报纸上几乎每天都有抢劫银行、入室行窃和拦路抢劫的报道。

example.ex: We usually think of a victim of mugging as being someone elderly.
example.tran: 我们通常以为被拦路抢劫的受害者是老年人。

value.def: If you say that someone is a mug, you mean that they are stupid and easily deceived by other people.

example.ex: He's a mug as far as women are concerned...
example.tran: 在女性眼里，他是个傻瓜。

example.ex: I feel such a mug for signing the agreement.
example.tran: 我觉得签这个协议真傻。

value.def: If you say that an activity is a mug's game, you mean that it is not worth doing because it does not give the person who is doing it any benefit or satisfaction.

example.ex: I used to be a very heavy gambler, but not any more. It's a mug's game...
example.tran: 我曾经是个赌棍，但现在再也不赌了，那是傻瓜的游戏。

value.tran: (不值得一做的)傻瓜的游戏，傻事

example.ex: He managed to get his ugly mug on the telly.
example.tran: 他设法让自己那张丑陋的脸上了电视。

trans: (尤指警方拍摄的罪犯的)面部照片，头像
